20110106231950.000|20110106231952.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN ANCHOR:  We, meaning

20110106231954.000|20110106231957.000|TR0|go the way of the dinosaurs.
20110106231957.000|20110106231959.000|TR0|
20110106231959.000|20110106232001.000|TR0|A new report shows that the Internet is 
20110106232001.000|20110106232003.000|TR0|gaining on television as Americans' main 
20110106232003.000|20110106232005.000|TR0|source of national and international news.
20110106232005.000|20110106232008.000|TR0|
20110106232008.000|20110106232010.000|TR0|A Pew survey shows overall 41 percent of 
20110106232010.000|20110106232012.000|TR0|those polled say they get their news now 
20110106232012.000|20110106232014.000|TR0|from the Internet.  That's up 17 percent 
20110106232014.000|20110106232017.000|TR0|from just three years ago.
20110106232017.000|20110106232019.000|TR0|
20110106232019.000|20110106232021.000|TR0|Television still tops the list as the main 
20110106232021.000|20110106232023.000|TR0|source of news at 66 percent, but that 
20110106232023.000|20110106232025.000|TR0|number is down significantly.  It was 82 
20110106232025.000|20110106232028.000|TR0|percent in 2002.
20110106232028.000|20110106232030.000|TR0|
20110106232030.000|20110106232032.000|TR0|Newspapers and radio are at the bottom of 
20110106232032.000|20110106232034.000|TR0|the heap in this survey.
20110106232034.000|20110106232037.000|TR0|
20110106232037.000|20110106232039.000|TR0|Although the use of the Internet for news 
20110106232039.000|20110106232041.000|TR0|is growing among all age groups, it's 
20110106232041.000|20110106232043.000|TR0|particularly pronounced among young people.
20110106232043.000|20110106232045.000|TR0|

20110106232048.000|20110106232050.000|TR0|was the main source of news for people

20110106234044.000|20110106234047.000|TR0|seriously wrong?
20110106234047.000|20110106234049.000|TR0|
20110106234049.000|20110106234051.000|TR0|TODD (voice-over):  Hobson then grabbed 
20110106234051.000|20110106234053.000|TR0|some camera equipment and started taking

20110106234055.000|20110106234058.000|TR0|dead fish rolling onshore and piling up 
20110106234058.000|20110106234100.000|TR0|just yards from her home on Kent Island, 
20110106234100.000|20110106234102.000|TR0|Maryland, along the Chesapeake Bay.  
20110106234102.000|20110106234104.000|TR0|Wildlife officials say roughly 2 million 
20110106234104.000|20110106234107.000|TR0|of one particular species died very 
20110106234107.000|20110106234109.000|TR0|suddenly.

20110106234113.000|20110106234115.000|TR0|THE ENVIRONMENT:  It's 99.99 percent spot,

20110106234126.000|20110106234129.000|TR0|this was caused by one traumatic event 
20110106234129.000|20110106234131.000|TR0|called cold stress.
20110106234131.000|20110106234133.000|TR0|
20110106234133.000|20110106234135.000|TR0|(on camera) You're looking at what 
20110106234135.000|20110106234138.000|TR0|wildlife experts call the juveniles of the 
20110106234138.000|20110106234140.000|TR0|species, the babies.  They say that this

20110106235047.000|20110106235049.000|TR0|instead of their TV screens, there will 
20110106235049.000|20110106235052.000|TR0|still be a need for responsible news 
20110106235052.000|20110106235054.000|TR0|reporting that people trust.  The Internet 
20110106235054.000|20110106235056.000|TR0|has no police or lie detector, and that 
20110106235056.000|20110106235058.000|TR0|makes it very hard to tell what's true and 
20110106235058.000|20110106235100.000|TR0|what's not true.  Since anyone can post to 
20110106235100.000|20110106235103.000|TR0|the Internet, bad information flies around 
20110106235103.000|20110106235105.000|TR0|there like crazy."
20110106235105.000|20110106235107.000|TR0|
20110106235107.000|20110106235109.000|TR0|Bob in Ohio: "Unfortunately, the validity
